result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges and DNA surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7-17-17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, credit for 150 days

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

Restitution set at zero.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications. 
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
May not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge if not already paid.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Zane Bernal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (27 pages) commencing on 07-17-2014 SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Linda H-A.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 150 days.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 07-17-2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge if not already paid, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 07-17-2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Advance/Improve education
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  On motion of both parties, Court ordered a presentence investigation without recommendation. Order for Presentence Investigation received and filed; copy to Probation Dept.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing to Br. 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark A. Dluzak in court, defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal not in court, in custody.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/20/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in custody.  William Levins for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Defendant Jonathan Zane Bernal in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
